pullRequest.body:
add the definition of `UnitInterval` as Submonoid of `Real`.

motivation: This enables the use of `prod_mem`.

suggested in #12266

  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11532861838/job/32105121769)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11532861838/job/32105121663)
Does that make the full name `unitInterval.unitIntervalSubmonoid`? That seems duplicative
right, what is the naming convention? `unitInterval.submonid`?
Does it work to just change the original definition, instead of making a new one? In other words, move this change to the top of the file, replacing lines 28-29.

I tried to change the definition of `unitInterval` as a `Submonoid `.
Below there are some instance definitions and there I get
"failed to synthesize
  CompactSpace I"
What should I do?
@jcommelin `unitInterval` is a reducible definition, so we reuse all instances about `Set.Icc (0 : Real) 1`. We can decide to change that, but IMHO this is out of the scope of this PR.
LGTM, but let's wait for @Ruben-VandeVelde and @jcommelin .
I removed the `awaiting-author` tag as the requested change seems unnecessary

I think the name should be changed to `unitInterval.submonoid`.

As for the change in the definition, I suggest that we change `unitInterval` into a coerced subtype (i.e., `UnitInterval : Type := { carrier := Set.Icc (0 : ) 1, ... : Submonoid  }`, but as Yury suggests, this can be done in a separate PR.
name changed.

```suggestion
/-- The unit interval as a submonoid of . -/
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Topology/UnitInterval): add unitInterval as Submonoid
